alert.note: Alert for Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 11 at 5:54AM CDT until July 11 at 6:45AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR WESTERN OKLAHOMA COUNTY... At 554 AM CDT, trained weather spotters flash flooding in Low lying and poorly drained areas across Edmond and Oklahoma City. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Oklahoma City, western Edmond, Midwest City, Del City, Bethany, Warr Acres, The Village, Spencer, Nichols Hills, Tinker Air Force Base, Forest Park, Lake Aluma, The Capitol and Downtown Edmond. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
